page.title: 07ST.HELIER HARBOUR
page.content: The harbour is vitally important to the people of Jersey because most of our needs: food, clothing, building materials, etc. have to be imported. The old harbour was probably for fishing boats. The two main piers were named after Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. Recent changes apart all piers including the New North Quay are 19thC The harbour is built of granite and the entrance is only 160 feet wide.The tide rises from a minimum of 9 feet to a maximum of 50 feet, so ships cannot always enter when they wish. At present 35 acres of sea are being reclaimed which will bring the total harbour area to 145 acres. There are over twenty arrivals daily, including 5 mailboats carrying as many as 6,000 people and roll on-roll off freight. 350,000 tonnes of freight arrives every year.
